params.note: Directed differentiation of human pluripotent stem cells (hPSCs) into distal lung organoids via sequential specification: hPSCs → definitive endoderm → anterior foregut endoderm → ventral anterior foregut endoderm → lung bud organoids → lung organoids.
Protocol duration: ~40 days to generate organoids; maintenance >180 days; maturation to second trimester gestational stage.
Organoids exhibit branching morphology, minimal non-lung endodermal lineages, presence of mesenchyme, and capacity to recapitulate interstitial lung diseases.
Protocol performed in serum-free conditions without lineage-specific reporters or enrichment steps.
Protocol includes generation of single-cell suspensions for single-cell RNA sequencing.
Stages: Embryoid body formation (d0-d6), Definitive endoderm induction (d6-d25), Anteriorization (d25), Lung bud organoid formation (d25-d150), Branching organoid formation (d150+).
Media components: CHIR 99021, BMP4, SB 431542, Activin A, FGF10, KGF (FGF7), Retinoic acid, IWP2, Y-27632.
Embedding in Matrigel for branching morphogenesis.
Organoids at d170 correspond to second trimester human lung development based on genome-wide expression analysis against Keygenes database.
AT2 cells emerge at tips; contain lamellar bodies (LBs); take up and secrete fluorescently labeled SFTPB.
Mesenchyme appears during anteriorization and ventralization; becomes scarce after Matrigel embedding.
Organoids model fibrotic interstitial lung diseases (ILDs), including Hermansky-Pudlak syndrome (HPS1, HPS2, HPS4 mutations).
HPS1−/− and HPS2−/− organoids show fibrotic changes; HPS8−/− do not.
Interleukin-11 identified as therapeutic target via comparative transcriptomics of fibrosis-prone vs. non-fibrosis-prone organoids.
Organoids can be infected by respiratory viruses: respiratory syncytial virus, parainfluenza, measles.
Infected epithelial cells dislodged into lumen, recapitulating bronchiolitis pathology.
Single-cell RNA sequencing and confocal analysis used to track loss of non-lung endodermal fates and acquisition of distal lung fate.
Undifferentiated endoderm persists early, suggesting potential for alternative endodermal fate induction with modified conditions.
Spontaneous branching suggests utility for studying morphogenetic signaling and transcriptional/epigenetic regulation of lung specification.
